title: Arsenal Women vs Chelsea Women — Preview
body: Arsenal's shot volume rose last week but accuracy dipped; Chelsea's defensive record remains steady. Arsenal's xG trend is positive over the last 3 matches. Key battles in wide areas. Expect a tight contest decided by pressing efficiency and set pieces. #WSL #ArsenalWomen #ChelseaWomen

title: Arsenal vs Chelsea — Post-Match Recap
body: Arsenal controlled possession but chance quality fluctuated. Chelsea's back line limited big chances. Foord's progressive carries stood out. Data Verdict: marginal xG edge, but finishing decided it. #WSLAnalytics

title: WSL Weekly Thread
body: 1️⃣ Arsenal's pressing recovered week-on-week. 2️⃣ Chelsea's GA unchanged despite rotation. 3️⃣ Brighton's possession improved but conversion lagged. #WSL #Analytics

title: Manchester City vs Aston Villa — Preview
body: City's rolling 10-game xG difference sits at +1.25, highest in the league. Villa concede most chances from cutbacks; City generate 32% of shots from those zones. Watch Shaw vs Corsie aerial duel. Expect City to overload left half-space. #WSL #MCWFC #AVWFC

title: Manchester United Depth Chart Analysis
body: Marc Skinner rotated 6 positions last fortnight; performance drop-off minimal. Data shows 0.12 xG per shot drop when Galton rests. Lucia Garcia adds 1.9 progressive carries per 90 from right flank. Depth manageable if midfield double pivot stays intact. #WSLAnalytics

title: Tottenham Hotspur vs Everton — Tactical Preview
body: Tottenham's PPDA improved from 11.3 to 8.9 since the break, powered by high-wing traps. Everton struggle versus aggressive presses, posting 58% pass completion under pressure. Expect Spurs to mirror box midfield to target weak Everton second-ball cover. #WSL

title: Brighton Build-Up Report
body: Brighton average 42% possession but create 60% of xG from sequences starting in their own third. Terland's hold-up play enables double-movements from Sarri. Need to cut turnovers between lines; 19% of conceded shots stem from misplayed vertical passes. #WSLAnalytics

title: Arsenal Women Set-Piece Evolution
body: Arsenal introduced near-post screen on corners, increasing shot quality from 0.09 to 0.14 xG per attempt in three matches. Catley delivery plus Ilestedt timing creating mismatch vs zonal markers. Expect opponents to assign man-mark plus blocker. #ArsenalWomen #WSL

title: Chelsea Pressing Refresh
body: Chelsea shifted Kerr into narrow starting spot, triggering press from inside-to-out. Result: opponent pass completion to final third down from 68% to 54% over last four fixtures. Reiten's counterpress recoveries up 35%. Watch for fatigue impacts late matches. #CFCW #Analytics

title: Aston Villa Midfield Pairing Review
body: Littlejohn and Dali pairing yields 0.6 xG created per 90 but concedes 0.4 xG from central turnovers. Data suggests staggering their starting positions cuts transition risk by 15%. Consider replacement with Lehmann when chasing games. #AVWFC #WSLAnalytics

title: Manchester City Transition Study
body: Bunny Shaw leads league with 0.35 xG from fast breaks per 90. Coombs' through-ball accuracy at 38% unlocks left channel. Defensive concern: City concede 0.18 xG/90 from direct counters when fullbacks overlap simultaneously. Solution: stagger Greenwood pushes. #WSL

title: Birmingham City Academy Watch
body: 17-year-old forward Poppy Wilson averaging 0.42 non-penalty xG in academy league with 62% shot accuracy. Tracking data notes 31 sprints per 90. Projected to earn senior bench role if pressing intensity translates. #WSL #YouthScouting

title: Reign vs Arsenal Friendly Recap
body: Arsenal trialed box midfield with Pelova at base. Pass network showed 15% increase in central density, but turnovers rose without Walti. Reign exploited wide isolation vs McCabe. Data: Arsenal xThreat 1.42 vs Reign 1.50. Friendly but instructive. #WSLAnalytics

title: League Goalkeeper Dashboard
body: WSL keepers facing 4.8 shots on target per match on average. Earps leads in goals prevented (+4.3), Musovic second (+3.1). Distribution metrics highlight Zinsberger's 86% short pass completion. Trend: more teams initiating via keepers to beat mid-block presses. #GoalkeeperUnion

title: Transfer Rumor Probability Model
body: Model ingesting social signals and historical patterns assigns 62% likelihood of Lauren James extension, 41% chance of City moving for Ona Batlle return. Weighted features: verified sources, timing within window, club roster gaps. Monitoring upcoming friendly minutes. #WSLAnalytics

title: Arsenal Injury Impact Assessment
body: With Mead returning, Arsenal's shot quality vs low blocks projects to rise 0.08 xG/shot. Without Kim Little, progressive passes drop 17%. Rotation plan should manage minutes with Pelova at 6. Expect minutes cap near 60 for Mead initially. #ArsenalWomen #InjuryReport

title: Chelsea Load Management Notes
body: Emma Hayes trimmed training RPE by 12% over past fortnight. Tracking data shows late-game sprint output now 94% of first-half levels. Rotating Buchanan/Mjelde maintains aerial duel win rate at 68%. Expect more minutes for youngster Nusken at hybrid 6/8. #CFCW

title: Emerging Tactics Roundup
body: 1️⃣ Spurs experimenting with inverted wing-backs to overload half-space. 2️⃣ Liverpool adopting zonal pressing triggers in middle third. 3️⃣ Leicester adding double pivot rotations to protect back line. Data indicates marginal gains in chance creation and prevention. #WSLAnalytics

title: WSLAnalytics Mailbag Vol. 1
body: Q: Which winger leads progressive carries? A: Hemp at 5.6 per 90. Q: Biggest pressing drop-off? Everton post-60' with PPDA rising to 13.2. Q: Team with top set-piece xG? Arsenal at 0.42 per match. Keep questions coming. #Mailbag #WSL
